text.*:
Scopper Gaban

Chapter Info

Volume:

112

Chapter:

1140

Japanese Title:

スコッパー・ギャバン

Romanized Title:

Sukoppā Gyaban

Viz Title:

Scopper Gaban

Pages:

17

Release Date:

February 24, 2025

WSJ Issue:

2025 Issue 13
Chapter Chronology
← Previous Next →
Chapter 1140 is titled "Scopper Gaban".

Contents

  • 1 Cover Page
  • 2 Short Summary
  • 3 Long Summary
  • 4 Quick References
    • 4.1 Chapter Notes
    • 4.2 Characters
  • 5 Author Comment
  • 6 Arc Navigation

Cover Page[]

Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage, Vol. 26: "Ulti: 'If anything happens to Pay-Pay, I'll hunt you to the depths of hell and beat you to death'"

Short Summary[]

Gaban and Luffy engage in battle with each other, but Gaban decides to surrender and let Luffy take the key to Loki's chains. Meanwhile, Shamrock and Gunko arrive near the Walrus School and plan to capture the giant children, with the assistance of two more members of the God's Knights: Sommers and Killingham.

Long Summary[]

Luffy asks Gaban why he needs to fight him for the key and insists he just give it up, while Road is confused regarding his reason for doing so. Gaban simply taunts Luffy by asking if he cannot do it, and that persuades him to jump off Road's hands to challenge him. He tries to grab the key from Gaban's hands, but Gaban swiftly dodges him multiple times. Luffy tells Gaban he just wants to free Loki so he can return to the feast, but Gaban just tells him to take it then. When Luffy tries to grab it, Gaban jumps into the air and coats the key with Haki before bringing it down on Luffy, which damages him to everyone's shock.

Luffy emerges from the rubble, now enraged, and Gaban notices Luffy's straw hat, which he says looks better on him than the helmet he has. Luffy tells Gaban that the hat is a treasure he is holding onto for Shanks, but hearing that prompts Gaban to call Shanks a cheapskate for not truly giving Luffy the hat. Luffy becomes enraged by that comment and ignorantly tells Gaban not to talk bad about Shanks when he does not even know him. This causes Gaban to shove the key into Luffy's mouth and shove him into a wall. Gaban then bradishes his axes and performs an attack called Yasotakeru, unleashing a flurry of axe strikes. Sensing the danger, Zoro jumps to Luffy's aid, using his swords to block the attack, which destroys part of the castle. Seeing Zoro come to Luffy's aid has Gaban think he found a good crew.

Following that, Luffy goes into Gear Fifth as both he and Zoro prepare to fight him. However, Gaban announces he yields, causing Luffy and Zoro to crash. The both of them angrily demand he take this fight seriously, but Gaban says that the key is now in their possession, since it was now on the ground next to him. Road tries to tell Luffy who Gaban really is, but the latter asks him not to be too hasty. As Gaban leaves, he tells Luffy that if Elbaph is still intact, by the time they leave, they should visit him. However, Luffy and Zoro angrily refuse. As he leaves, Gaban thinks back to when Shanks spoke to him about Luffy, and Gaban asks why he should trust him, prompting Shanks to tell him to do as he pleases then.

At the Walrus School, some of the kids notice a weird-looking bird, but Ange does not see it. What the kids actually saw was the bird-looking construct Gunko made for her and Shamrock to land on the tree's branches. Once they do, Gunko creates the Magic Circle, but instead of summoning one God's Knights, she ends up summoning two: Saint Sommers of the Shepherd Family and Saint Killingham of the Rimoshifu Family. Interestingly, neither of them were expecting to be summoned as Sommers was still in his underwear talking about the food shortage, while Killingham was in a rush to be somewhere as he is late. The two finally realize they have been summoned to Elbaph.

While Sommers gets dressed, Shamrock asks why two were summoned when he just asked for one, and Killingham tells him it is because he is being summoned back to Mary Geoise as everything had been falling apart since the Levely. Sommers asks Shamrock what he is even doing here and if he was paying Harald's grave a visit, but Shamrock explains the situation to the both of them. Sommers says that they will not be able to stuff kids they take in a bag, while Killingham says those without the mark cannot travel through the "Abyss", meaning they will need to move them by ship. Shamrock, however, evilly tells the two of them that with their abilities, they can make a game out of kidnapping the children.

Quick References[]

Chapter Notes[]

  • Gaban fights against Luffy but eventually surrenders and lets him take the key to Loki's chains.
    • As Gaban surrenders the key, Road tries to reveal his identity to Luffy's group, but Gaban stops him for now.
    • Gaban invites Luffy to come see him again after Elbaph is "safe".
    • As he leaves, Gaban thinks back to Shanks telling him about Luffy, and encouraging Gaban to trust the boy.
  • Shamrock and Gunko arrive at the Sun World overlooking the Walrus School.
  • Gunko manifests a Magic Circle to summon reinforcements.
    • Saint Shepherd Sommers and Saint Rimoshifu Killingham of the God's Knights appear in Elbaph. Killingham appears to be an Awakened Mythical Zoan user.
    • Killingham informs Shamrock that he has been ordered back to Mary Geoise.
    • Shamrock orders Sommers, Killingham, and Gunko to kidnap as many of the Giant children as possible and return them to Mary Geoise.
    • Killingham laments that without the "mark", they cannot bring the giants through the "Abyss", so they must be transported by boat.
    • Shamrock suggests for them to make a "game" out of it.

God's Knights

  • Manmayer Gunko
  • Shepherd Sommers
  • Rimoshifu Killingham

Author Comment[]


Author Comment
  • Translation
  • Original


In order to get the Max Pokémon, I walked around the city for three hours after finishing this week's chapter. My feet are like lead.


キョダイマックスバトルの為原稿明け3時間も都会を歩いて足が棒の様です。

—Eiichiro Oda
English translation by VIZ Media. For comprehensive translation credits, see here.

==Cover Page==
[[Oni Child Yamato's Golden Harvest Surrogate Pilgrimage]], Vol. 26: "Ulti: 'If anything happens to Pay-Pay, I'll hunt you to the depths of hell and beat you to death'"

==Short Summary==
[[Scopper Gaban|Gaban]] and [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] engage in battle with each other, but Gaban decides to surrender and let Luffy take the key to [[Loki]]'s chains. Meanwhile, [[Figarland Shamrock|Shamrock]] and [[Gunko]] arrive near the Walrus School and plan to capture the [[Giants|giant]] children, with the assistance of two more members of the [[God's Knights]]: [[Shepherd Sommers|Sommers]] and [[Rimoshifu Killingham|Killingham]].

==Long Summary==
[[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] asks [[Scopper Gaban|Gaban]] why he needs to fight him for the key and insists he just give it up, while [[Road]] is confused regarding his reason for doing so. Gaban simply taunts Luffy by asking if he cannot do it, and that persuades him to jump off Road's hands to challenge him. Luffy tells Gaban he just wants to free [[Loki]] so he can return to the feast, but Gaban just tells him to take it then. When Luffy tries to grab it, Gaban jumps into the air and coats the key with [[Haki/Armament Haki|Haki]] before bringing it down on Luffy, which damages him to everyone's shock.

Luffy emerges from the rubble, now enraged, and Gaban notices Luffy's [[Straw Hat|straw hat]], which he says looks better on him than the helmet he has. Luffy tells Gaban that the hat is a treasure he is holding onto for [[Shanks]], but hearing that prompts Gaban to call Shanks a cheapskate for not truly giving Luffy the hat. This causes Gaban to shove the key into Luffy's mouth and shove him into a wall. Gaban then bradishes his axes and performs an attack called ''Yasotakeru'', unleashing a flurry of axe strikes. Sensing the danger, [[Roronoa Zoro|Zoro]] jumps to Luffy's aid, using his swords to block the attack, which destroys part of the castle. Seeing Zoro come to Luffy's aid has Gaban think he found a good crew.

Following that, Luffy goes into [[Gomu Gomu no Mi/Gear 5 Techniques|Gear Fifth]] as both he and Zoro prepare to fight him. However, Gaban announces he yields, causing Luffy and Zoro to crash. As Gaban leaves, he tells Luffy that if [[Elbaph]] is still intact, by the time they leave, they should visit him. However, Luffy and Zoro angrily refuse. As he leaves, Gaban thinks back to when Shanks spoke to him about Luffy, and Gaban asks why he should trust him, prompting Shanks to tell him to do as he pleases then.

At the Walrus School, some of the kids notice a weird-looking bird, but [[Ange]] does not see it. What the kids actually saw was the bird-looking construct [[Gunko]] made for her and [[Figarland Shamrock|Shamrock]] to land on the tree's branches. Once they do, Gunko creates the [[Abyss|Magic Circle]], but instead of summoning one [[God's Knights]], she ends up summoning two: [[Shepherd Sommers|Saint Sommers]] of the [[Shepherd Family]] and [[Rimoshifu Killingham|Saint Killingham]] of the [[Rimoshifu Family]]. Interestingly, neither of them were expecting to be summoned as Sommers was still in his underwear talking about the food shortage, while Killingham was in a rush to be somewhere as he is late. The two finally realize they have been summoned to Elbaph.

While Sommers gets dressed, Shamrock asks why two were summoned when he just asked for one, and Killingham tells him it is because he is being summoned back to [[Mary Geoise]] as everything had been falling apart since the [[Levely]]. Shamrock, however, evilly tells the two of them that with their abilities, they can make a game out of kidnapping the children.
